title: Xbox 360 Turns 20: Here Are Its Top 20 Best-Selling Games In The US
description: By     Blair Marnell   on November 23, 2025 at 7:06AM PST                                GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from...
body:
By 
    Blair Marnell
   on November 23, 2025 at 7:06AM PST    
          
                  GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
                This weekend marks the 20th anniversary Xbox 360, the second iteration of Microsoft's Xbox consoles. There were a lot of great Xbox 360 games during its run. But looking back, it's staggering to see how many of the top-selling Xbox 360 games were from the Call of Duty franchise.Circana's Mat Piscatella has shared the 20 best-selling Xbox 360 games in the US, and 7 out of the 20 were Call of Duty titles. Six of those games were in the top 10, and four out of the top five as well.Three Halo games and two Gears of War titles made the list, as did perennial best-sellers Minecraft and The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim. Since the acquisitions of Bethesda, Activision, and Mojang Studios, Microsoft now owns the rights to 17 of the titles on this list.Outside of Microsoft's dominion, Rockstar Games had two of the most-acclaimed titles of that generation: Red Dead Redemption and Grand Theft Auto 4. Meanwhile, EA's Battlefield 3 was the publisher's sole title to make the list.Peter Moore--the former Microsoft executive who oversaw Xbox and Xbox 360--recently shared some of the history behind the latter's battle with the PlayStation 3 for the hearts and minds of gamers. The Xbox 360 is one of the biggest hits that Microsoft has ever had in the gaming realm. Although the Xbox 360 store was shut down last year, Microsoft shared an update for the system in June 2025.The complete list of the top 20 best-selling Xbox 360 games in the US is reproduced below. Most of the titles are still available to play on the Xbox Store.20. Gears of War 3Developer: Epic GamesRelease Date: September 20, 201119. Gears of WarDeveloper: Epic GamesRelease Date: November 7, 200618. Red Dead RedemptionDeveloper: Rockstar GamesRelease Date: May 18, 201017. Battlefield 3Developer: DICERelease Date: October 25, 201116. Guitar Hero 3: Legends of RockDeveloper: NeversoftRelease Date: October 28, 200715. MinecraftDeveloper: Mojang StudiosRelease Date: November 18, 201114. Grand Theft Auto 4Developer: Rockstar GamesRelease Date: December 8, 200813. Call of Duty: World at WarDeveloper: TreyarchRelease Date: November 11, 200812. The Elder Scrolls 5: SkyrimDeveloper: Bethesda Game StudiosRelease Date: November 11, 201111. Rock BandDeveloper: HarmonixRelease Date: November 20, 200710. Halo 4Developer: 343 IndustriesRelease Date: November 6, 20129. Call of Duty: GhostsDeveloper: Infinity WardRelease Date: November 13, 20138. Halo: ReachDeveloper: BungieRelease Date: September 14, 20107. Call of Duty 4: Modern WarfareDeveloper: Infinity WardRelease Date: September 14, 20106. Grand Theft Auto 5Developer: Rockstar GamesRelease Date: September 12, 20135. Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2Developer: Infinity WardRelease Date: November 8, 20094. Halo 3Developer: BungieRelease Date: September 25, 20073. Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3Developer: Infinity Ward/Sledgehammer GamesRelease Date: November 8, 20112. Call of Duty: Black OpsDeveloper: TreyarchRelease Date: November 9, 20101. Call of Duty: Black Ops 2Developer: TreyarchRelease Date: November 13, 2012

title: Mario & Sonic At The Olympic Games 2020 Is 50% Off
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
    
              
          
                                                                                                                                                               The 2026 Winter Olympics take place next February in Milano and Cortina, Italy, but you can get a head start with your own virtual Olympics thanks to a Black Friday deal dropping Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games Tokyo 2020 for Nintendo Switch down to $30 (was $60). That's just barely above its all-time low price of $29.53. While Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games Tokyo 2020 is focused on Summer Olympic sports, Amazon's 50% discount is a great way to get in the Olympic spirit a few months before the winter event kicks off.                                 Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games Tokyo 2020                                                                $30 (was $60)                                                                                                                                                                                    Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games Tokyo 2020 features 34 events, a variety of minigames, and both single-player and multiplayer modes. You'll find all the Summer Olympic staples here, taking you from the track to the swimming pool and boxing ring to the archery range. Each event ranges in complexity--most feature easy-to-learn controls, while others, like soccer and rugby, offer more depth and challenge, making this a great minigame collection for players of all skill levels. The roster of playable characters includes familiar faces from both the Sonic and Mario series, including the titular mascots themselves, and friends like Luigi, Tails, Waluigi, Dr. Eggman, and more.                      Our Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games Tokyo 2020 review gave it a 7/10, due to its entertaining events (each with its own gimmick) and unique control schemes that make it easy to find a playstyle that works for just about everyone."Mario & Sonic at the Tokyo Olympic Games 2020 is an entertaining take on the sports-event genre that has, by and large, disappeared in the modern-day," wrote critic James O'Connor. "The game aims for accessibility at every opportunity, and while nothing about it is particularly exceptional, it still has plenty of unique flourishes to offer, and the wealth of different events and simple controls make for an appealing casual multiplayer title. Thanks to a generous selection of events and a few neat gimmicks, Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games Tokyo 2020 is the best entry in this series."Amazon is discounting several other Switch exclusives for Black Friday 2025, including hits like Super Mario Odyssey, but the deals are selling out quickly. We've listed the remaining Nintendo Switch discounts available at Amazon below. We also have a Black Friday Deals Hub where you'll find even more deals on games for other platforms like PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X, as well as the latest price cuts on Blu-rays, Lego sets, anime, and more.Best Switch Exclusive Black Friday 2025 DealsKirby's Return to Dream Land Deluxe -- $40 ($60)Luigi's Mansion 3 -- $40 ($60)Super Mario Odyssey -- $30 ($60)Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games Tokyo 2020 -- $30 ($60)Mario + Rabbids Dual Pack -- $15 ($30)                                                                                                                                               Sign up for GameSpot's Weekly Deals Newsletter:                                The First PS5 Pro Deal In Six Months Is Up For Grabs For A Limited Time                         Ghost Of Yotei PS5 Slim Bundles And Collector's Edition Get Huge Discounts                         Save Big On 8BitDo's Stellar Ultimate 2 Controllers In Amazon's Black Friday Sale                                   + Show More More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders Links (5)                 Evercade Retro Handhelds & Cartridges Get Rare Price Cuts In Amazon's Black Friday Sale                         Kirby Air Riders Buying Guide: Release-Day Delivery Still Available At Amazon                         Meta Quest 3S Black Friday Deal - Save Up To $70 And Get $50 Amazon Credit                         Grab A Wireless GameCube-Style Controller For Switch 1/2 & PC For Only $40                         Amazon-Exclusive Lunar Remastered Collection Gets First Price Cut

title: The New Edition Of Catan Is Nearly 50% Off For Black Friday
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
    
              
          
                                                                                                                                                               Catan 6th Edition is on sale for its lowest price since launching in April. Normally $55, the popular strategy board game is discounted to only $30 in Amazon's Black Friday sale. This is a Lightning Deal, and over 50% of units have been claimed at the time of writing. The 6th Edition is the same strategy game you know and love, just with quality-of-life improvements, a fresh coat of paint, and an improved rulebook that will make it easier than ever for new players to learn the basics.Catan players can also save big on 6th Edition add-ons, including the Seafarers Expansion for $42 (was $56) and Cities & Knights for $45 (was $60). Catan Studio also recently released a 6th Edition for the Traders & Barbarians Expansion, and this one is on sale for $55 (was $65). You can also save on 5-6 Player Expansions and Replacement Card Sets for select campaigns. The only 6th Edition theme not on sale is Explorers & Pirates, but there are plenty of other great board game deals in Amazon's Black Friday sale.Catan Board Game & Expansion Set Deals (6th Edition)Catan 6th EditionCatan Board Game -- $30 ($55)5-6 Player Expansion -- $22 ($30)Replacement Card Set -- Sold outCatan: Seafarers Expansion -- $41 ($56)5-6 Player Expansion -- $28.49 ($34)Catan: Cities & Knights Expansion -- $45 ($60)5-6 Player Expansion -- $36Replacement Card Set -- $12 ($14)Catan: Traders & Barbarians Expansion -- $55 ($65)5-6 Player Expansion -- $32 ($38)Replacement Card Set -- $14Catan: Explorers & Pirates Expansion -- $655-6 Player Expansion -- $38                                 Catan 6th Edition & Expansions                                                                The latest iteration of Catan released released in April.                                                                                                                                                                                    Catan first launched in 1995, with each new edition slightly tweaking its appearance and gameplay. The fifth edition in 2015 marked a big change for the brand, as it moved from “The Settlers of Catan” to simply “Catan.” This new sixth edition doesn’t do anything quite so radical, but it does offer a more inclusive adventure and an improved eco-friendly design.Here’s a look at everything that’s changed:Updated graphics: You’ll now find brighter artwork and modern designs that make the game easier to parse. This also includes new character illustrations with greater diversity.Premium, eco-friendly components: Components are crafted with less plastic and an eye for sustainability. You’ll also find new textured hex tiles and updated card trays that make it easier to stay organized.Smart storage: The 5-6 Player Extension Pack contents can now fit inside the base game box, so you can more easily transport all your pieces.Improved rulebook: While the rules are the same, the rulebook has been updated with clearer graphics and gameplay examples, helping new players learn the basics.If you own other Catan expansions, you should be able to use them with the new 6th Edition. The rules remain the same across all editions, but you’ll have to deal with conflicting art styles.
